lines: 1. He leadeth me! O blessed thought! O words with heavenly comfort fraught Whate'er I do, where'er I be, Still 'tis God's hand that leadeth me.
Refrain : He leadeth me, He leadeth me By His own hand He leadeth me; His faithful follower I would be, For by His hand He leadeth me.
2. Sometimes 'mid scenes of deepest gloom, Sometimes where Eden's bowers bloom By waters still, o'er troubled seaâ€”Still 'tis His hand that leadeth me!
3. Lord, I would clasp my hand in Thine, Nor ever murmur nor repine-Content, whatever lot I see, Since 'tis my God that leadeth me.
